            Email 1:
Hello Mr. Johnson,                    We require a 36,000MT cargo of iron ore from Santos to Richards Bay. We’ve got a very strong buyer who wants a May delivery, could you commit to that?                    You mentioned your vessel has the capacity to do a 2-week voyage – is that the case?                    Best Regards,                    David
Email 2:
Dear Sir/Madam,                  We’re interested in trading iron ore with you. A friend of mine was recommended to me and I’ve been meaning to get in contact with you for a while now. Would you be free to speak to me about it?                  Thanks,                  John

### Current email sections:
* Your message, if you want to write one.
* Options to send the message.

### Best to reply by mail
> Correspondence from John, David and Alice
John has selected 2 weeks for his voyage duration, so you’ll reply to him with your best quote within 2 weeks. But why not send your quote to all 3 customers at once? Click the gear icon on the current messages to specify your pricing term.

> Going from A to B

He’s asked you for a quote, so you can easily fill in your lead time and calculate the exact date
Email 3:
Dear David,                  We can offer you a discount on our shipments, if you can book us an entire ship. For the capacity we’ve got (45,000MT), we can offer a 3% discount for early bookings.                Regards,                    Jenny

### Connecting voyages together

> Another option
Alice has left the details for her message in the same form as John. This means you can send a personalised quote and attach all the supporting documentation in one click.

### Note to self
> Have a look at your next message

This tab will help you keep track of your email conversations: see what messages you’ve seen and what you’re about to respond to.

> What next?
You can choose what you do next with the emails that have come in. See how you’ve done so far.

### Use an automated reply

Not sure if you can reply to this customer yet
Email 4:
We can offer you a discount on our shipments, if you can book us an entire ship. For the capacity we’ve got (45,000MT), we can offer a 3% discount for early bookings.                Regards,                    Jenny

Please have a look at your inbox for our last message. If we’re looking to book an entire ship, we can’t offer any discount. We’d like to hear back from you before our next message reaches you.

> We want to book an entire ship
Sending you this reply will prevent John and David from seeing it, so we can send a more personalised message.

> No more messages in draft

### You could reply with this message

You could reply with this message
Email 5:
Hello again. We can offer you a discount on our shipments, if you can book us an entire ship. For the capacity we’ve got (45,000MT), we can offer a 3% discount for early bookings.                Regards,                    Jenny

We have to send this message at the very last minute before the quote arrives. This is because we’ve agreed to trade iron ore, which we cannot do while John and David are in charge of this shipment. They will look at this message before receiving your next quote. You can see this by clicking your recent message, which you’ll find on the “previous message” button.

### Manage your previous messages

Looking at this message in your inbox will tell you everything you need to know, and even if John or David have replied. You can also open any message for a read-only view that will let you view attachments, mark as read

### Step 1: Install the module

This is a special module for advanced users and developers. It requires the execution of a file with extended permission (755) in the folder scripts/ . The file to be executed is mod_latestmail.php .
```
mod_latestmail  
```
  1. Create the folder scripts/ .
  2. Set the execute permission of the file mod_latestmail.php to 755.

# Bulk vs Loop – Top 5 SQL Performance Comparisons

### Bulk Update and Delete

The first bulk versus loop comparison is bulk update and delete operations. A bulk update or delete can be viewed as a more or less complicated data type conversion. Instead of processing rows with SELECT, UPDATE, or DELETE, one can convert them in bulk.

Bulk update and delete can be a lot faster than UPDATE and DELETE. While UPDATE and DELETE are based on changing one row at a time, a bulk update or delete can change or remove many rows at a time.
